update.description:
This is a first version of VicinityPlugin.

Topic name, distance threshold and update rate can be configured from urdf/sdf.
Some things could be improved like memory management, getting the RobotNamespace from URDF instead of hard coding it, homogenize variables naming etc.. but as the other plugins don't do it so I think we can merge this as is and revisit later along the other plugins if we have time

* remove commented code, add distance detection and id publication

* readding collision actor plugin that disappeared during merge
update.title: RFID

This is a first version of VicinityPlugin.

Topic name, distance threshold and update rate can be configured from urdf/sdf.
Some things could be improved like memory management, getting the RobotNamespace from URDF instead of hard coding it, homogenize variables naming etc.. but as the other plugins don't do it so I think we can merge this as is and revisit later along the other plugins if we have time

update.title: RFID

content.raw:
* Oh sorry, agreed about `RobotNamespace`
* Not completely sure that the threshold should necessarily match the guest pick-up radius, I can imagine in real life the RFID range is shorter than the distance the robot needs to get a person's attention. It certainly is less confusing it they match though.
* About the lack of room to get out of a room, we'll try to leave more space around the table do the robot could go around. The reasoning is that in a real-life situation, the robot shouldn't expect that the guest would accommodate the robot by getting out of the way.
content.html:
• Oh sorry, agreed about RobotNamespace
  • Not completely sure that the threshold should necessarily match the guest pick-up radius, I can imagine in real life the RFID range is shorter than the distance the robot needs to get a person's attention. It certainly is less confusing it they match though.
  • About the lack of room to get out of a room, we'll try to leave more space around the table do the robot could go around. The reasoning is that in a real-life situation, the robot shouldn't expect that the guest would accommodate the robot by getting out of the way.

content.raw:
Thanks for the follow-up! a few remarks:
- the TODO I was thinking of adding a `RobotNamespace` tag to match the behavior of the other gazebo_ros plugins as the namespace used on the ROS side may not match the sdf model name. Though it's not a blocker as for now as we expect them to be the same for this competition.
- I construct the list of actors on Load for performance reasons. That may not hold if we decide to implement an alternative behavior for the guest when they reach drop_off point (more details below)
- We should document that the threshold should match the one used in the competition plugin for guest pickup, not sure what the best place for that is

Details about Actors list:
We discussed with @chapulina alternatives to get the guest out of the way once being droped off. My suggestion would be to do a videogame style animation: the robot cannot move and the guest magically gets to the right spot that is out of the way.
A way to do so would be to delete the guest model and to spawn another model sitting on a chair or whatever in the meeting room, this way the robot has room to get out. The tricky part about that is that the plugin will have no knowledge of the new actor spawned so won;t publish info about it. That could be ok as we dont expect this guest to ever move after that (of the robot to have to use RFID if the competition is always a single guest pickup + dropoff) but I think it's worth mentioning.
content.html:
Thanks for the follow-up! a few remarks: - the TODO I was thinking of adding a RobotNamespace tag to match the behavior of the other gazebo_ros plugins as the namespace used on the ROS side may not match the sdf model name. Though it's not a blocker as for now as we expect them to be the same for this competition. - I construct the list of actors on Load for performance reasons. That may not hold if we decide to implement an alternative behavior for the guest when they reach drop_off point (more details below) - We should document that the threshold should match the one used in the competition plugin for guest pickup, not sure what the best place for that is

Details about Actors list: We discussed with @chapulina alternatives to get the guest out of the way once being droped off. My suggestion would be to do a videogame style animation: the robot cannot move and the guest magically gets to the right spot that is out of the way. A way to do so would be to delete the guest model and to spawn another model sitting on a chair or whatever in the meeting room, this way the robot has room to get out. The tricky part about that is that the plugin will have no knowledge of the new actor spawned so won;t publish info about it. That could be ok as we dont expect this guest to ever move after that (of the robot to have to use RFID if the competition is always a single guest pickup + dropoff) but I think it's worth mentioning.

content.raw:
Awesome, @mikaelarguedas , this works for me!

I have a few minor suggestions on pull request #52:

* Address the TODO
* Add a bit of documentation
* Remove `boost:bind`

I also added the new topic to the API wiki page and walkthrough.
content.html:
Awesome, @mikaelarguedas , this works for me!

I have a few minor suggestions on pull request #52:

  • Address the TODO
  • Add a bit of documentation
  • Remove boost:bind

I also added the new topic to the API wiki page and walkthrough.
